author: Special Correspondent
text:
The corporation on Monday held a meeting to seek suggestions for speeding up the works for setting up an integrated bus stand at Vellalore.

Corporation Commissioner K. Vijayakarthikeyan presided over the meeting. Officials from the corporation, TNSTC, Regional Transport Department, and Tangedco participated.

The proposal is to construct an integrated bus stand at Vellalore at an outlay of Rs. 172 crore on about 50 acres.

Once the bus stand becomes operational, the mofussil bus stand, State Express Transport Corporation bus stand, and Omni bus stand at Gandhipuram will be shifted.

The meeting focused on ascertaining the congestion on various roads when buses are routed to Vellalore. The civic body will send its final report to the government after getting opinions from all concerned.
title: Vellalore bus stand: meeting held
